code:
export var continents=[{name:"AFRICA",link:"/africa",text:"Africa is the second largest continent and accounts to
       one-fifth of Earth's land area. 
       It is bulging to the west and is surrounded by oceans and seas.
       However, it is considered underpopulated as about 10% of the
       Earth's population lives here despite of its huge size."},{name:"ANTARCTICA",link:"/antarctica",text:"Antarctica is the driest, southernmost, windiest and least populated continent on Earth. 
      It has the highest average height above sea level. 
      It contains the geographical South Pole and is located entirely in the Southern Hemisphere.
      It was discovered by the Russian expedition of Fabian Gottlieb von Bellingshausen and Mikhail Lazarev.
      It was much neglected in the 19th century because of its harsh climate. 
      It is governed by the Antarctic Treaty System. 
      The treaty prohibits military activities, mineral mining, nuclear explosions and nuclear waste disposal while, 
      supports scientific research and protects the continent's ecology. 
      "},{name:"ASIA",link:"/asia",text:"Asia is the world's largest and most populous continent. 
      It accounts to 30 percent of Earth's surface area. 
      It is a land of extremes and has both the highest and lowest points on Earth.
      The highest and lowest temperature on Asia are 50 degree Celcius and 
      -57 degree Celcius at Jacobabad of Pakistan and Verkhoyansk of Siberia respectively.
      Huge countries such as China, India and Russia are present here."},{name:"AUSTRALIA",link:"/australia",text:"Australia is the smallest, flattest, lowest and second driest continent.
       It is called the island continent as it is surrounded by water on all sides.
       It lies completely in the Southern Hemisphere. The other surrounding islands,
       New Zealand, Papua New Guinea, etc are also considered part of this contiinent."},{name:"EUROPE",link:"/europe",text:"Europe is the world's second smallest continent. 
       It is a cluster of peninsulas and islands that extends North-West of Asia.
       Despite of it's northern location, most of Europe enjoys mild climate tempered 
       by warm ocean currents."},{name:"NORTH AMERICA",link:"/north-america",text:"North America is the third-largest continent by area, and 
      the fourt-largest continent by population. 
      It consists of mainly three countries which is the USA, Canada, and Mexico. 
      The other countries are much smaller in size. 
      The continent lies in the Northern Hemisphere and mostly in the western hemisphere.
      It is bordered by the Pacific, Atlantic, and Arctic Oceans in the West, South and North respectively.
      "},{name:"SOUTH AMERICA",link:"/south-america",text:"South America is roughly a triangular continent. 
      It has an area of about 6.9 million square kilometers and is slightly smaller than North America.
      It is connected by the Isthmus of Panama to North America. 
      In the south, it is separated from Antarctica by the Drake passage.
      The continent has a regular coastline and relatively few islands. 
      Relative to Europe, Asia and Africa, 20th-century South America has been a peaceful continent with few wars.
      "}];

sourcesContent:
export const continents = [
    {
      name:"AFRICA",
      link:"/africa",
      text: `Africa is the second largest continent and accounts to
       one-fifth of Earth's land area. 
       It is bulging to the west and is surrounded by oceans and seas.
       However, it is considered underpopulated as about 10% of the
       Earth's population lives here despite of its huge size.`
    },
    {
      name:"ANTARCTICA",
      link:"/antarctica",
      text:`Antarctica is the driest, southernmost, windiest and least populated continent on Earth. 
      It has the highest average height above sea level. 
      It contains the geographical South Pole and is located entirely in the Southern Hemisphere.
      It was discovered by the Russian expedition of Fabian Gottlieb von Bellingshausen and Mikhail Lazarev.
      It was much neglected in the 19th century because of its harsh climate. 
      It is governed by the Antarctic Treaty System. 
      The treaty prohibits military activities, mineral mining, nuclear explosions and nuclear waste disposal while, 
      supports scientific research and protects the continent's ecology. 
      `
    },
    {
      name:"ASIA",
      link:"/asia",
      text:`Asia is the world's largest and most populous continent. 
      It accounts to 30 percent of Earth's surface area. 
      It is a land of extremes and has both the highest and lowest points on Earth.
      The highest and lowest temperature on Asia are 50 degree Celcius and 
      -57 degree Celcius at Jacobabad of Pakistan and Verkhoyansk of Siberia respectively.
      Huge countries such as China, India and Russia are present here.`,
    },
    {
      name:"AUSTRALIA",
      link:"/australia",
      text:`Australia is the smallest, flattest, lowest and second driest continent.
       It is called the island continent as it is surrounded by water on all sides.
       It lies completely in the Southern Hemisphere. The other surrounding islands,
       New Zealand, Papua New Guinea, etc are also considered part of this contiinent.`,
    },
    {
      name:"EUROPE",
      link:"/europe",
      text:`Europe is the world's second smallest continent. 
       It is a cluster of peninsulas and islands that extends North-West of Asia.
       Despite of it's northern location, most of Europe enjoys mild climate tempered 
       by warm ocean currents.`,
    },
    {
      name:"NORTH AMERICA",
      link:"/north-america",
      text:`North America is the third-largest continent by area, and 
      the fourt-largest continent by population. 
      It consists of mainly three countries which is the USA, Canada, and Mexico. 
      The other countries are much smaller in size. 
      The continent lies in the Northern Hemisphere and mostly in the western hemisphere.
      It is bordered by the Pacific, Atlantic, and Arctic Oceans in the West, South and North respectively.
      `,
    },
    {
      name:"SOUTH AMERICA",
      link:"/south-america",
      text:`South America is roughly a triangular continent. 
      It has an area of about 6.9 million square kilometers and is slightly smaller than North America.
      It is connected by the Isthmus of Panama to North America. 
      In the south, it is separated from Antarctica by the Drake passage.
      The continent has a regular coastline and relatively few islands. 
      Relative to Europe, Asia and Africa, 20th-century South America has been a peaceful continent with few wars.
      `
    }
]
